com.ambrosus.utils

Class CryptoUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ambrosus.utils.CryptoUtils

  • public abstract class CryptoUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for crypto-related operations.

    • Method Detail

      • computeSignature

        public static java.lang.String computeSignature(java.lang.String message,
                                                org.web3j.crypto.ECKeyPair keyPair)
        Computes the signature of a string message with the provided key pair.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to be signed.
        keyPair - The key pair to use for signing.
        Returns:
        A string containing the hexadecimal representation of the signature

      • computeHashString

        public static java.lang.String computeHashString(java.lang.String message)
        Computes the Ethereum hash of the provided message string. It consists of a Keccak256 hash of the message string prefixed with "Ethereum Signed Message:\n" and the length of the message.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to be hashed.
        Returns:
        A string with the hexadecimal representation of the hash.

      • signatureMatches

        public static boolean signatureMatches(java.lang.String message,
                                       java.lang.String candidateAddress,
                                       java.lang.String hexSignature)
        Recovers the address of the message signatory and compares it to a given address. The address is recovered by computing the hash of the message and using the signature provided in the method parameters.
        Parameters:
        message - The message that was hashed and signed.
        candidateAddress - The address to be verified.
        hexSignature - The signature of the message, as a hexadecimal string.
        Returns:
        True if the address recovered from the message and the signature matches the candidate address. Returns false otherwise.

      • hashMatches

        public static boolean hashMatches(java.lang.String message,
                                  java.lang.String candidateHash)
        Compute the Ethereum Keccak256 hash of the given message and compares it to a given hash.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to be hashed.
        candidateHash - The hash to be verified, as a hexadecimal string.
        Returns:
        True if hashing the message with the Ethereum Keccak256 hash function yields the same value as the hash given in parameter. Returns false otherwise.
